initialQuestions.question: How are you planning to use Modeliks?
initialQuestions.description: How are you planning to use Modeliks?

initialQuestions.question: What is your company name?
initialQuestions.description: Don't worry if you have not decided yet on your company name - you can change it later.

initialQuestions.question: What is your industry?
initialQuestions.description: We'll customize your Modeliks experience based on your choice.

initialQuestions.question: Want to use a pre-defined financial model based on your industry?
initialQuestions.description: Modeliks did the heavy lifting for you, pre-defined industry models are here to make your life event easier!
options: No, I build my own model
initialQuestions.defaultValue: No, I build my own model

initialQuestions.question: What's the first month in your plan?
initialQuestions.description: Modeliks' forecast allow for monthly inputs in the first year. Ideally the forecast year starts with your accounting year. No worries if not, we can work through this later too.

initialQuestions.question: For how many years are you planning?
initialQuestions.description: Typical planning periods are 3 or 5 years. You can re adjust this later if you change your mind.

initialQuestions.question: For how many years do you intend to plan on a monthly basis?
initialQuestions.description: Typically company plan 1 to 2 years on monthly basis and the rest of the years on annual basis.

initialQuestions.question: Which currency do you want to use?
initialQuestions.description: If you are not sure what currency to use, don't worry, you can change it later!

initialQuestions.question: Want to collaborate? Add users!
initialQuestions.description: Collaboration is at the center of all we do! Want to add your colleagues and users directly? Else you can always add and adjust your team in user settings later.

fields.label: What is the business called?
fields.description: If you don't have a name yet, give it a temporary name and change it later.

fields.label: What does the business do?
fields.description: Keep this short like digital marketing agency, food truck, financial advisory, etc.

fields.label: Where is the business located?
fields.description: If in multiple locations, provide the city, state, and country of the head office.

fields.label: When was the business established?
fields.description: If not established yet, tell us when you plan to establish it.

fields.label: What are your business values?
fields.description: Business values are the fundamental beliefs and guiding principles that shape a company's culture, decision-making, and overall behavior.

fields.label: How is the business structured legally?
fields.description: Select one of the following common business structures or add your own.

fields.label: Who are the business owners?
fields.description: List the names of the owners and their percent ownership in the company.

fields.label: What products will your business sell?
fields.description: Define the products that you plan to sell. Services that you sell will be defined later. Skip if you don't offer products

fields.label: What services will your business provide?
fields.description: Now define the services your business will offer. Skip if you don't offer services

fields.label: What intellectual property does the business own or have access to?
fields.description: Intellectual property such as patents, copyrights, trademarks, franchise, trade secrets, digital assets. If this does not apply to your business you can skip this section.

fields.label: What problems do your potential customers typically face?
fields.description: Identify the problems or challenges your potential customers often face. Next, you will describe how your business solves these problems.
options: Long wait times for seating or food
Limited menu options or dietary restrictions

fields.label: How does your business solve these problems?
fields.description: Explain how your business solves each problem and the benefits that customers get when using your product or service.
problems: Long wait times for seating or food

fields.label: What is your geographical target market?
fields.description: Define where you sell your products and services.

fields.label: What are the current market trends?
fields.description: Identify key trends affecting your industry and market.
options: Investment in technology for online ordering systems
Increased interest in sustainable and eco-friendly practices
Collaboration with local farms and artisans

fields.label: Who are your target customers?
fields.description: Define the buyer personas for your business.
options: Families seeking affordable dining options for occasions and gatherings
Local farmers and workers looking for hearty, traditional meals after a long day
Tourists exploring the area and searching for unique, regional cuisine experiences
Elderly residents who value home-cooked meals and community atmosphere
Young couples looking for romantic date nights or special celebrations
Health-conscious individuals seeking fresh, locally-sourced menu items
Students searching for budget-friendly meals and casual dining environments

fields.label: What are your Critical Success Factors?
fields.description: Define the critical success factors for your business.

fields.label: Competitor Analysis
fields.description: Compare yourself and each competitor along the critical success factors. Green means best in class. Yellow means average performance. Red means poor performance or not available at all.

fields.label: What are the steps that your customers go through?
fields.description: Define all relevant steps that your customers go through when buying your products and services.

fields.label: List your company's physical locations.
fields.description: This might be your office, store locations, manufacturing plants, storage facilities, etc.

fields.label: What equipment do you need for your business?
fields.description: List any specialty equipment that you need to operate your business.

subsections.title: Financial Plan
subsections.description: See your Forecast and analyze your future financial projections.

subsections.title: Executive Summary
subsections.description: See your Forecast and analyze your future financial projections.
